intro: Myosotis sylvatica, commonly known as the woodland forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it thrives in moist, shady environments. Myosotis sylvatica is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also found in wildflower meadows.
